title: crit for a logotype
content:
Hello and Shalom.  
my name is yaron from israel.  
i usualy deal with hebrew typography, so this is quite new for me and i would love to get another opinion on this.

this is a photographer that deals with photojounalism on one side, and artistic nude and foot fetish photography on the other side.  
the key words were "bold, lacks inhibition, but also sophisticated, sexy, and sensous"  
therefor i searched for bold and italic fonts like  
"bauer bodoni black italic" which really gave me that kind of feeling.

i showed the client a type test with some 50 fonts related to that style, and we agreed on the bauer bodoni combined with the "F" letter of "Benguiat" font.  
along the way i noticed seceral problems like "il" letters and the "fi" ligature, so i tried to work it out.

i would like to get a critique for a logotype, especially concerning kerning and typo :)  
i can't change the font because of tight schedule, but i would like to hear your opinion on my font choice.

thanks alot,  
Yaronimus

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021143552im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo%20sk_5064.png)
author: Yaronimus-Maximus

comments.content:
Of your options the bottom one is working best – it definitely needs a ligature, although the word space is a touch wide and the Ye could be a touch tighter.

If you wanted to push it further Stilla might be an option, the E+F cut has an fi ligature

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stilla/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021143552/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stilla/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/stilla/")

Tim

The bottom is my favorite too. However, I prefer the ligature of the il in the option just above. Nice work with the fi.

Pdub

thank you very much tim and Pdub.

tim - when you say "word space" which word do you meen exactly?  
stilla is cool, but a bit too funky for my client.

Pdub - that's funny, well, maybe because english is my second laguage i feel that the Il looks like LL which is confusing. doesn't an IL ligature in this type affect legibility? isn't this a problem in english?

another question - isn't the logo a bit too long?  
maybe a sub line with something like "art & press photography" would be better for the logo?

thanks!

Yaron,  
I meant the space between Ilia and Yefimovich, my feeling is that given the tight kerning of the names that space is just too wide.

As for the logo being too long, it might present a problem – at a small size you might need to look at a more spaced version at the smaller (business card) sizes. I think adding a strap line would give you a hefty block which could be clumsy to work with in a layout.

Tim

I'm with Pdub on this one.

like the ligatures, but feel overall the kerning is too tight
